pkgmetadata.longdescription: Count and Continuous Generalized Variability Indexes // Univariate Poisson dispersion index (DI) for count data, univariate exponential variation index (VI) for positive continuous data functions are performed. Also, the generalized dispersion index (GDI) and the marginal dispersion index (MDI) functions are carried out. Finally, the generalized variation index (GVI) and the marginal variation index (MVI) functions are computed. See Abid et al. (2020), Fisher (1934), Kokonendji and Puig (2018), Kokonendji et al. (2020) and Tour et al. (2020) for more details on these indexes.
